data

Class GameData

  • java.lang.Object
    • data.GameData

  • public class GameData
extends java.lang.Object
    GameData is the class that will be used to keep track of the important game information, including the number of weeks passed, the lists of all/active contestants, and the number of weeks remaining.
    Author:
    Graem Littleton, Ramesh Raj, Justin McDonald, Jonathan Demelo, Kevin Brightwell

    • Field Summary

      Constructors

      GameData(int numContestants)
      Constructor method that takes a set number of contestants.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addContestant(Contestant c)
      Adds a new contestant into the Game, this will maintain the list of contestants as sorted by ID.
      void advanceWeek()
      advanceWeek sets the number of weeksPassed to weeksPassed + 1.
      static void endCurrentGame()
      Nulls the current game stored, allows a new game to start.
      java.lang.String generateContestantID(Contestant c)
      Uses the stored first and last name, and the currently running Game to generate a unique user ID.
      java.util.ArrayList<Contestant> getActiveContestants()
      getActiveContestants returns an array (list) of the contestants that are still competing in the game.
      java.util.ArrayList<Contestant> getAllContestants()
      getAllContestants returns a list of all current and former contestants that are/have been involved with the game.
      Contestant getContestant(java.lang.String first, java.lang.String last)
      getContestant takes the first and last name of a contestant as input and searches the array of current contestants for him/her.
      private int getContestantIndexID(java.lang.String id)
      Helper method to get the index of a contestant ID in the activeContestants array
      static GameData getCurrentGame()
      Returns the currently stored Game, this removed need to reference the game data all the time.
      int getCurrentWeek()
      Get the current week in play.
      java.lang.String[] getTribeNames()
      getTribeName returns a String array with two entries: the name of the first tribe, and the name of the second tribe.
      static GameData initGameData(java.lang.String inputFile)
      intGameData reads in a data file and builds a GameData object out of it, returning it to the user.
      boolean isIDInUse(java.lang.String id)
      Tells whether an ID is in use.
      boolean isIDValid(java.lang.String id)
      Checks if an ID string passed in is valid amongst the currently loaded ID tags.
      private static void readFile(java.lang.String file)
      reads in file and (supposed) to fill in appropriate game data
      void removeContestant(Contestant target)
      removeContestant takes a Contestant object as input and attempts to remove it from the array of active contestants.
      void seasonMade()
      seasonCreated sets the seasonMade boolean to true, indicating that there exists a GameData object to be used.
      void setTribeNames(java.lang.String tribeOne, java.lang.String tribeTwo)
      setTribeNames sets both tribe names accordingly and stores them in the tribeNames string array.
      void startGame()
      startGame sets gameStarted to true, not allowing the admin to add any more players/Contestants to the pool/game.
      int weeksLeft()
      weeksLeft returns the number of weeks remaining before the game ends.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameData

        public GameData(int numContestants)
        Constructor method that takes a set number of contestants. Will not proceed if numContestants is NOT between 6 and 15, inclusive. Sets number of weeks passed to 0 and weeks remaining to number of contestants - 3.
        Parameters:
        numContestants - number of contestants to be in game

    • Method Detail

      • getActiveContestants

        public java.util.ArrayList<Contestant> getActiveContestants()
        getActiveContestants returns an array (list) of the contestants that are still competing in the game.
        Returns:
        The contestants active

      • getAllContestants

        public java.util.ArrayList<Contestant> getAllContestants()
        getAllContestants returns a list of all current and former contestants that are/have been involved with the game.
        Returns:
        this.allContestants

      • getContestant

        public Contestant getContestant(java.lang.String first,
                       java.lang.String last)
        getContestant takes the first and last name of a contestant as input and searches the array of current contestants for him/her. Returns information found in the Contestant class to the caller.
        Parameters:
        first - First name
        last - Last name
        Returns:
        contestant or string object

      • addContestant

        public void addContestant(Contestant c)
        Adds a new contestant into the Game, this will maintain the list of contestants as sorted by ID.
        Parameters:
        c - New contestant, will not add if ID of contestant is null.

      • getTribeNames

        public java.lang.String[] getTribeNames()
        getTribeName returns a String array with two entries: the name of the first tribe, and the name of the second tribe.
        Returns:
        String array tribe names

      • weeksLeft

        public int weeksLeft()
        weeksLeft returns the number of weeks remaining before the game ends.
        Returns:
        this.weeksRem

      • getCurrentWeek

        public int getCurrentWeek()
        Get the current week in play. Starts from Week 1.
        Returns:
        Current week

      • advanceWeek

        public void advanceWeek()
        advanceWeek sets the number of weeksPassed to weeksPassed + 1.

      • removeContestant

        public void removeContestant(Contestant target)
        removeContestant takes a Contestant object as input and attempts to remove it from the array of active contestants. Maintains sorted ID order
        Parameters:
        target - eliminated contestant

      • startGame

        public void startGame()
        startGame sets gameStarted to true, not allowing the admin to add any more players/Contestants to the pool/game.

      • seasonMade

        public void seasonMade()
        seasonCreated sets the seasonMade boolean to true, indicating that there exists a GameData object to be used.

      • setTribeNames

        public void setTribeNames(java.lang.String tribeOne,
                 java.lang.String tribeTwo)
        setTribeNames sets both tribe names accordingly and stores them in the tribeNames string array.
        Parameters:
        tribeOne - name of tribe one
        tribeTwo - name of tribe two

      • initGameData

        public static GameData initGameData(java.lang.String inputFile)
        intGameData reads in a data file and builds a GameData object out of it, returning it to the user.
        Parameters:
        inputFile - file to be read in
        Returns:
        GameData object made out of file or null if season not created

      • generateContestantID

        public java.lang.String generateContestantID(Contestant c)
        Uses the stored first and last name, and the currently running Game to generate a unique user ID.
        Parameters:
        c - contestant to use data from.

      • isIDValid

        public boolean isIDValid(java.lang.String id)
        Checks if an ID string passed in is valid amongst the currently loaded ID tags. Also checks if the syntax is valid.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID tag to check
        Returns:
        True if valid to use

      • getContestantIndexID

        private int getContestantIndexID(java.lang.String id)
        Helper method to get the index of a contestant ID in the activeContestants array
        Parameters:
        id - Search Contestant ID
        Returns:
        Index in activeContestants where ID is stored, else < 0.

      • isIDInUse

        public boolean isIDInUse(java.lang.String id)
        Tells whether an ID is in use.
        Parameters:
        id - The Contestant ID is in use.
        Returns:
        True if in use.

      • readFile

        private static void readFile(java.lang.String file)
        reads in file and (supposed) to fill in appropriate game data
        Parameters:
        file - the file that contains the data

      • getCurrentGame

        public static GameData getCurrentGame()
        Returns the currently stored Game, this removed need to reference the game data all the time. But also allows objects to read data, cleanly.
        Returns:
        Currently started game, null if none present.

      • endCurrentGame

        public static void endCurrentGame()
        Nulls the current game stored, allows a new game to start.
